title: Drawing, 1881
medium: Pen and brown ink on off-white wove paper.
markings: Watermark:  monogram CFI; Stamped in red ink, at lower right: Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper-Union.
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink on dory: red, green.
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description:
Recto: In upper half, women stand at a railing and watch the fishermen and the sea; at left is a house with a hipped roof and porch; beyond the railing, four dories are drawn up on beach.  Framing lines.  In lower half: details of three women [in a grouping similar to the one on the verso], and one dory with color notations.
  
Verso, drawn in opposite direction: three women and a child stand behind a railing; in background are dories, heads of fishermen, sea.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1881.
1881. Pen and brown ink on off-white wove paper.. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-16.
